ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Don't take this class if it's not required. Too much pain for too little gain. Some of the advanced undergraduate macro courses may be more enlightening.

Whether I would recommend the course depends strongly on who is teaching. See comments above. Please note that the follow multiple choice responses pertain only to Professor Atkeson's quarter, as I feel this information is more pertinent.
I would not recommend the first half of the course, there is little added value in the lectures.
Recommended, of course, since it's a required course and teaches the fundamentals of macro economic analysis

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course extended my knowledge of the discipline to the extent that it introduced ways to solve macroeconomic models, and some examples of seminal models.
Gave my good tools, but still did not get enough economic interpretation/insights.
I now know a lot more about the field than I did before.
Learn basic macro economics analysis techniques and standard models
